messages.text:
No, that comment is just calculus nothing more. If you have that line of code in there, then you're saying is:

if for any delta t, p(dt) derivative is ever small, then it's zero.

So choose dt small enough such that it's true for every component. It's trivial you can do that, right? so now choose N s.t. N*dt walks to the end. Therefore the solution is constant zero

messages.text:
```const temp = zeros(10000)

function new_odefcn!(dpdt,p,whatsthis,t)
   n  = 10000
   n = convert(Int64,n)
   nk = 700
   nk = convert(Int64,nk)
   k1 = 0.6
   k2 = 26000
   alpha = 9000
   m = 6
   l = 6
   a = 1
   b = 2
   c_Zr = 0.0144
   c_B  = 0.0163
   Na = 6.02214e23
   invna = 1/Na
   all_i = 1:n

   @inbounds for i = 1:nk
       for j = i:n
           if j == i
               if i == 1
                   for ii = 1:n
                       temp[ii] = all_i[ii]*p[ii]
                   end
                   total_p1 = sum(temp)
                   M = c_Zr - (total_p1*m)
                   L = c_B - (total_p1*l)
                   if total_p1 > 0
                       k1 = k1*alpha*total_p1
                   end
                   dpdt[j] = dpdt[j] + (k1*(M^a)*(L^b))
               end
               dpdt[j] = dpdt[j] - (k2*p[i]*sum(@view(p[i:n-i])))
           elseif (j<(i+i)) && (j!=i)
               dpdt[j] = dpdt[j] - (k2*p[i]*p[j])
           elseif j >= (i+i)
               if j+i <= n
                   dpdt[j] = dpdt[j] - (k2*p[i]*(p[j] - p[j-i]))
               elseif j+i > n
                   dpdt[j] = dpdt[j] + (k2*p[i]*p[j-i])
               end
           end
       end
   end
end```

elements.text:
const temp = zeros(10000)

function new_odefcn!(dpdt,p,whatsthis,t)
   n  = 10000
   n = convert(Int64,n)
   nk = 700
   nk = convert(Int64,nk)
   k1 = 0.6
   k2 = 26000
   alpha = 9000
   m = 6
   l = 6
   a = 1
   b = 2
   c_Zr = 0.0144
   c_B  = 0.0163
   Na = 6.02214e23
   invna = 1/Na
   all_i = 1:n

   @inbounds for i = 1:nk
       for j = i:n
           if j == i
               if i == 1
                   for ii = 1:n
                       temp[ii] = all_i[ii]*p[ii]
                   end
                   total_p1 = sum(temp)
                   M = c_Zr - (total_p1*m)
                   L = c_B - (total_p1*l)
                   if total_p1 > 0
                       k1 = k1*alpha*total_p1
                   end
                   dpdt[j] = dpdt[j] + (k1*(M^a)*(L^b))
               end
               dpdt[j] = dpdt[j] - (k2*p[i]*sum(@view(p[i:n-i])))
           elseif (j<(i+i)) && (j!=i)
               dpdt[j] = dpdt[j] - (k2*p[i]*p[j])
           elseif j >= (i+i)
               if j+i <= n
                   dpdt[j] = dpdt[j] - (k2*p[i]*(p[j] - p[j-i]))
               elseif j+i > n
                   dpdt[j] = dpdt[j] + (k2*p[i]*p[j-i])
               end
           end
       end
   end
end

messages.text: that's a faster version of your model, but of course it's going to have the same issues. But that `@view` is something to think about, the reuse of the temporary is a good idea, and put `@inbounds` on only after debugging.

is something to think about, the reuse of the temporary is a good idea, and put
@inbounds
on only after debugging.
